intro: Amsinckia ovaticarpa, commonly known as the woolly goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers in late spring to early summer, which are clustered in dense, spherical heads. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Amsinckia ovaticarpa is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value.
